channel.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
channel.description:
For all those who like to read, try reading this. It's an apology for ever voting for Bush. Very funny, and very realistic. If you don't know what a word means, don't tune out. Just look it up on dictionary.com :) New Link: http://www.kabc.com/mcintyre/listingsEntry.asp?ID=432586&PT=McIntyre+in+the+Morning Quote from the Article.
Katrina, Harriet Myers, The Dubai Port Deal, skyrocketing gas prices, shrinking wages for working people, staggering debt, astronomical foreign debt, outsourcing, open borders, contempt for the opinion of the American people, the war on science, media manipulation, faith based initives, a cavalier attitude toward fundamental freedoms-- this President has run the most arrogant and out-of-touch administration in my lifetime, perhaps, in any American’s lifetime.
Please do not post without reading it first. Enjoy! :) ~Ron

item.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:2, topic:5935”]I voted for George W. Bush, and I am glad that I did.

The way I see it, I didnt have a choice, I didnt like either candidate, they both seemed like lousy candidates, so what do you do when somthing like this happens? vote for the better choice, the lesser of two evils, that answer was Bush. (period) ;)[/quote]

Mopar, will you become the next president? 1st action: destroy all cars except Mopar’s

Read full topic

item.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:5935”]Can you exaplin what was so bad about Kerry? Was it because he was a liberal. Theonly thing I didn’t like about him was that he supported the Iraq war.

Other than that anybody’s excuse for not voting for him was because he has a “horse face”. The appearance of the president has nothing to do with how well he can manage the governement. Just in case if you used that as an excuse. Mopar, all I want to know is, why do you think Kerry would not have been a better president than Bush.

Small quote from the apology by the way.

TalkShowHost's-Apology:

Katrina, Harriet Myers, The Dubai Port Deal, skyrocketing gas prices, shrinking wages for working people, staggering debt, astronomical foreign debt, outsourcing, open borders, contempt for the opinion of the American people, the war on science, media manipulation, faith based initives, a cavalier attitude toward fundamental freedoms-- this President has run the most arrogant and out-of-touch administration in my lifetime, perhaps, in any Americanâ€™s lifetime.

Oh em gee, look at everything he did. That was just a small amount of it too. Did you read that in the article Mopar? :)[/quote] Hes creepy. Duh.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:38, topic:5935”]The Bush family and the Bin Laden family are very close friends. Did you know we were the ones that trained Osama Bin Laden before he turned on us because he wanted American bases out of all Islamic countries? That is also a fact.

Slightly offtopic but as philo said, a pissing contest. And since I’m pissing, I might as well piss some more. Bush’s dad was a merchant of war in WWII. He sold weapons to Germany lol. What a prick. That came out in the 90s during his presidency. So just goes to show how great and patriotic they are.[/quote]
yep and you would have been against going to war with germany the entire time.

item.source: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!

item.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

Ron:

You just kicked right wing, conservative, too religious, pruny pilgrim ass! Nice!

This isn’t a pissing contest, and I don’t need a cheerleader. Thanks anyway.

ruler:

I am a libertarian that disagrees with the their view on defense.

Whose view?

ruler:

I don’t read the newspapers. Show me a war where people gained rights during the war instead of lossing them. I was talking about controlling the courts awards for medical mal-practice. I am afraid that rights should be detered unless racial/country-orgin profiling is allowed during wartime.

This didn’t at all respond to my question. I did not ask, “Why are we waging the first war that resulted in limited domestic rights?” Because we aren’t. My question, again, is:

Where in the Constitution does it state that we have certain, inalienable rights – unless we are at war, in which case they may be flung out the window as a handful of people in the executive branch see fit?

[quote=“ruler, post:28, topic:5935”]“The federal government was granted strictly limited powers and should at no point be allowed to exceed them.”
the only way your going to promote this is by strict term limits or even term length, power corrupts thus have people in office as short as possible.[/quote]

Term limits have nothing to do with this. A 98% incumbency rate in the legislature is frightening and pitiful, sure. That’s more an issue of corrupted election funding than it is of term limits. Publicly funded elections put this to rest quickly and easily. We can easily pay for it by slashing the defense budget heavily.

The real plan here is, God forbid, to actually proceed to put the government back in its place. Which is a very small hole in the corner of our society, performing the menial tasks which were assigned to it by the authors of the foundational document of the entire structure of our government. This should be highly agreeable to everyone in the nation, save the Washington cabal.

[quote=“ruler, post:28, topic:5935”]philodespotos , “The agenda that Bush’s little group of neo"conservative"s promote is certified lunacy”
What were you refering to besides stem cell research veto and funding religious charities.[/quote]

Could it have been rapidly unfettering the executive branch at the expense of a balanced federal government? Foreign policy which apparently has no acquaintance with what it means to deal with “foreigners” or what it means to form rational “policy?” Dismissing all previous legal constraints placed upon our military’s behavior? Attempting to justify a debate about whether torture, “in this case” – because of a freshly redefined legal term – is acceptable, while calling themselves the “protectors of freedom and justice?” Overturning, at the very least, 60 years worth of diplomatic precedent in waging a preemptive war against a country which couldn’t have managed to conquer Luxemburg? Claiming all life to be sacred, shortly to be followed by, “I’d say, uhh, maybe 30,000 civilians have died in this war”? Issuing signing statements at a rate never before heard of, effectively saying, “Sure, Congress passed this law, but I don’t actually have to pay attention to it”? Placing the executive branch above the law itself? Discarding the fundamental tenets of Western society?

No, you’re right. Must’ve been stem cells and religious charities.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:34, topic:5935”][quote]god i wish it was, it would make more sense then “iraqi freedom”. We gave them months and months to move the weapons and bury them. The us people would be more approving if we were pumping it dry and giving them lower prices due to it. However i think their is greater reasons that will become evident down the road.
P[/quote]

Do you know where Bush Sr. was on 9/11? He was meeting with Osama Bin Ladens brother. THat is a fact.

Have you heard of the Carlyle Group? The oil pipeline built through Afghanistan was only possible after US incursion. That is a fact.

http://www.spectrezine.org/global/carlyle.htm[/quote]
Osama Bin has a big family, with many ties to the US due to afgansitan war and espically saudi arabia. I was not aware he was meeting with his brother, however osama’s family doesn’t talk with osama

Oil ouptut from the iraq is still not up to the pre-war times. not to mention all the oil that got out under the radar, oil for food.

Do you not see that this is economical. All that money that use to go to Russia, France, and Germany now flows to US companies.

item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]Even though in Clinton’s administration, the Nasdaq was about 1500 points higher. Tongue

It’s better for our stock markets to do badly, in the long run, given the US national debt.[/quote]
So a crash would get us out of dept…quickest solution is hyper-inflation.
The stock market generates cash out of thin air. We give countries paper dollars for useful products. They countires usually re-invest the money in us bonds, real estate. They often get bruned by us in their investments. Also they usually take the money and invest it in their military which loses its value very very quickly.

Also about the Nasdaq, Greenspan destroyed it. He saw a bubble and raised rates. He did it too much and we entered a recesssion. then came 9-11. Now its Housing that is the enemy. Central Banks hunt growth.

item.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

How is it better for our stocks to do badly. Isn’t the national debt at like 4 or 5 trillion now. Jeez what a big defecit. :eek:

I guess we are still working on stem cell research, but the church and bush are trying to prevent it. And even though bush didn’t support government funding for stem cell research, he also didn’t want it altogether. He made an open statement saying it was wrong and he agreed with the church.

Starting a bloody war for oil might be a good start?
lol nice. Who knows if it was for oil though. Remember what I said before ruler, he's making money on it. Okay I think I beat that horse to death since yous till don't believe me because you think Bush isn't involved in the oil business. :P

item.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:26, topic:5935”][quote author=philodespotos link=topic=7995.msg88864#msg88864 date=1153857065]
And according to “the Christians,” we were hit by a hurricane because New Orleans is full of licentious evildoers. Worse yet: there are gay people!

See how empty that statement is? Blanket generalizations contribute nothing.

I voted for Bush in 04, I was not old enough in 00. And about the people losing rights it is normal under war time. the democrat solution is no invasion, no offense, pure defense. For defense to work, it will require the complete lost of rights, do you know how difficult defnse is compared to offense?

I’m afraid I must’ve missed that amendment when I was last reading the Constitution. Which one says, “The rights enumerated above are only applicable if the federal government is not at war, and when it is, uhhh, nevermind”? My acquaintance with the law is limited; please clear this up for me. We don’t get to prattle on about being “defenders of liberty” and such things if we’re willing to curtail rights because we’re “at war.” Wartime is when they must be most unfettered.

Civil rights being protected from interference by the government is the core value of our society. This is absolutely non-negotiable.

Oh i bet your one of millions that all cried when bush decided not to fund FEDERAL stem cell research. Look any company can go out and do research, however the incentive is reduced due to all the health oriented lawsuits daily, also the animal rights/eco-terrorist groups really attract labs to the US. perhaps instead of spending tax dollars, the courts should be controlled.

Assumptions&asses&suchlike. I really don’t know where this came from, besides being an easy way to call me a liberal, and showing you read the newspaper. A noble attempt, but you know nothing of my politics. Nor do I understand what “eco-terrorist” groups have to do with what you’ve just said, or how “controlling the courts” would do anything to alleviate your concerns, but I’m sure it made sense when you were writing it.

Spare me the rhetoric and namecalling.
[/quote]

You just kicked right wing, conservative, too religious, pruny pilgrim ass! Nice!

I totally agree with those statements. Althought I did support stemcell research. Every other country is doing it and advancing in the medical area and we’re losing touch because in America the right wing christians are saying, No! Stem cell research is wrong! Just wrong! I think the people need to wake up and take a breath of reality.

Once we said that if God wanted man to fly he would give us wings and now the pope flies. In another 10 years we’ll begin stem cell research and get rid of the church bullshit (hopefully). :rolleyes:

How do you want leading the country? someone who decides based on polls like the clintons. Personally I fear mob-rule.

Incoherent. Dunno what Clinton had to do with anything. Haven’t the slightest what a graph of the NASDAQ is supposed to demonstrate. Or how mob-rule suddenly got injected into the conversation. Maybe had you finished that last sentence, it would make more sense to me.

lol, yeah I was wondering about that chart, per haps he was trying to show Bush’s dctatorship over Clinton’s democracy with a chart of the Nasdaq to show how much better we are now?

Even though in Clinton’s administration, the Nasdaq was about 1500 points higher. :P[/quote]
I am a libertarian that disagrees with the their view on defense.

philodespotos , “The agenda that Bush’s little group of neo"conservative"s promote is certified lunacy”
What were you refering to besides stem cell research veto and funding religious charities.

I don’t read the newspapers. Show me a war where people gained rights during the war instead of lossing them. I was talking about controlling the courts awards for medical mal-practice. I am afraid that rights should be detered unless racial/country-orgin profiling is allowed during wartime.

“The federal government was granted strictly limited powers and should at no point be allowed to exceed them.”
the only way your going to promote this is by strict term limits or even term length, power corrupts thus have people in office as short as possible.

Read full topic

@PaulT wrote:

I totally agree with those statements. Althought I did support stemcell research. Every other country is doing it and advancing in the medical area and we're losing touch because in America the right wing christians are saying, No! Stem cell research is wrong! Just wrong! I think the people need to wake up and take a breath of reality.

Once we said that if God wanted man to fly he would give us wings and now the pope flies. In another 10 years we’ll begin stem cell research and get rid of the church bullshit (hopefully). Roll Eyes

We’re doing fine on stem cell research. What Bush didn’t support was government funding of a certain type of stem cell research.

Even though in Clinton's administration, the Nasdaq was about 1500 points higher. Tongue

It’s better for our stock markets to do badly, in the long run, given the US national debt.

I’m afraid I must’ve missed that amendment when I was last reading the Constitution. My acquaintance with the law is limited; please clear this up for me. We don’t get to prattle on about being “defenders of liberty” and such things if we’re willing to curtail rights because we’re “at war.” Wartime is when they must be most unfettered.

Civil rights being protected from interference by the government is the core value of our society. This is absolutely non-negotiable.

Oh i bet your one of millions that all cried when bush decided not to fund FEDERAL stem cell research. Look any company can go out and do research, however the incentive is reduced due to all the health oriented lawsuits daily, also the animal rights/eco-terrorist groups really attract labs to the US. perhaps instead of spending tax dollars, the courts should be controlled.

Assumptions&asses&suchlike. I really don’t know where this came from, besides being an easy way to call me a liberal, and showing you read the newspaper. A noble attempt, but you know nothing of my politics. Nor do I understand what “eco-terrorist” groups have to do with what you’ve just said, or how “controlling the courts” would do anything to alleviate your concerns, but I’m sure it made sense when you were writing it.

Spare me the rhetoric and namecalling.[/quote]

You just kicked right wing, conservative, too religious, pruny pilgrim ass! Nice!

I totally agree with those statements. Althought I did support stemcell research. Every other country is doing it and advancing in the medical area and we’re losing touch because in America the right wing christians are saying, No! Stem cell research is wrong! Just wrong! I think the people need to wake up and take a breath of reality.

How do you want leading the country? someone who decides based on polls like the clintons. Personally I fear mob-rule.
[/quote]

Incoherent. Dunno what Clinton had to do with anything. Haven’t the slightest what a graph of the NASDAQ is supposed to demonstrate. Or how mob-rule suddenly got injected into the conversation. Maybe had you finished that last sentence, it would make more sense to me.[/quote]

Even though in Clinton’s administration, the Nasdaq was about 1500 points higher.

item.title: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

ruler:

According to the muslims we got the hurricane bc we support Isreal.

And according to “the Christians,” we were hit by a hurricane because New Orleans is full of licentious evildoers. Worse yet: there are gay people!

See how empty that statement is? Blanket generalizations contribute nothing.

ruler:

I voted for Bush in 04, I was not old enough in 00. And about the people losing rights it is normal under war time. the democrat solution is no invasion, no offense, pure defense. For defense to work, it will require the complete lost of rights, do you know how difficult defnse is compared to offense?

I’m afraid I must’ve missed that amendment when I was last reading the Constitution. Which one says, “The rights enumerated above are only applicable if the federal government is not at war, and when it is, uhhh, nevermind”? My acquaintance with the law is limited; please clear this up for me. We don’t get to prattle on about being “defenders of liberty” and such things if we’re willing to curtail rights because we’re “at war.” Wartime is when they must be most unfettered.

Civil rights being protected from interference by the government is the core value of our society. This is absolutely non-negotiable.

ruler:

Oh i bet your one of millions that all cried when bush decided not to fund FEDERAL stem cell research. Look any company can go out and do research, however the incentive is reduced due to all the health oriented lawsuits daily, also the animal rights/eco-terrorist groups really attract labs to the US. perhaps instead of spending tax dollars, the courts should be controlled.

Assumptions&asses&suchlike. I really don’t know where this came from, besides being an easy way to call me a liberal, and showing you read the newspaper. A noble attempt, but you know nothing of my politics. Nor do I understand what “eco-terrorist” groups have to do with what you’ve just said, or how “controlling the courts” would do anything to alleviate your concerns, but I’m sure it made sense when you were writing it.

Spare me the rhetoric and namecalling.

I applaud all around that the federal government is not going to be funding stem cell research, but I heartily disagree on the rationale. It has nothing to do with the “culture of life” or whatever the operative term is today. That’s none of the government’s concern; the federal government has no place spending money on research. (Nor subsidizing ‘defense’ research, but we’ll set that aside for the moment) The federal government was granted strictly limited powers and should at no point be allowed to exceed them.

The market can handle funding research, and is doing so.

ruler:

How do you want leading the country? someone who decides based on polls like the clintons. Personally I fear mob-rule. At least when

Incoherent. Dunno what Clinton had to do with anything. Haven’t the slightest what a graph of the NASDAQ is supposed to demonstrate. Or how mob-rule suddenly got injected into the conversation. Maybe had you finished that last sentence, it would make more sense to me.

Awaiting clarification with bated breath.

item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“kmb, post:21, topic:5935”][quote author=Ron link=topic=7995.msg87658#msg87658 date=1153821733]
Yup! That’s true. Invading Iraq was the worst move ever. His family is applauding, but we the citizens still got shafted. Costs about $36 now to fill up my gas tank! That pisses me off.
[/quote]
Damn, how big is your gas tank :S? It costs about 9 euros to fill up my moped’s tank, which is 6.5 fricken litres! Gas is about 1.4-1.5 euros per litre here in Finland. Talk about gas prizes…[/quote]
RRR lol so lucky.

[quote=“ruler, post:22, topic:5935”][quote author=Ron]

ruler:

Can you show me a chart of Bush networth?

You are the chart master. Use your common sense. He’s in the oil business, oil businesses have trippled. Only a moron would think he lost money lol.
[/quote]
He was in the oil business i think over 15 years ago. If he tripled his money due to the war the media would be all over it… I don’t even know if he owns oil stocks.[/quote]
Are you kidding me??? It’s a known fact, his family is in the oil industry. The whole family owns Oil wells and everything. Oh ya, wake up from the American dream, the news is controlled. Mark my words, him making money on oil, will be all over the news in like 2 years when he leaves. They exclude a lot of things in the news… If you read the apology, which I doubt you did, then you would have learned something.

[quote=“Ron”][quote=ruler]
I wish the US would start increasing Iraq oil production, that would help offset costs.
[/quote]
Yes… because we have soo much of it in the USA. lol, we have so little now, and we can only pump so much. Higher gas means we better be looking for an alternate fuel source.[/quote]
their is alot of oil in the gulf, off cali coast, off florida coast, in alaska that is not being tapped due to enviromental laws.
[/quote]
Yeah yeah I know we have oil, but we’re running out. We can have small amounts of oil in 1000s diff places, but the point is… we are seriously running out. In the next 10-20 years, gasoline will be gone. In the next 5 years (I’m hoping), we will switch to a different source of energy.

[quote=ruler] Ya i am sure if we didn't invade Iraq, oil would be cheap and china would not be growing. [/quote] Yup! That's true. Invading Iraq was the worst move ever. His family is applauding, but we the citizens still got shafted. Costs about $36 now to fill up my gas tank! That pisses me off.
it was sarcasm. Ya the Iraq war created this.....: [/quote] I realized. :)

Read full topic
item.source: Really interesting Apology! - Come all Bush Haters!
